entry.title: Systems Analyst II (Applications) - Competition No. 115.13
entry.content:
Information Technology Division
Operations Section

Regular Full Time Position
Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.
Bargaining Unit Position
Wage: $36.90/hour

The primary role of this position is to customize, maintain and support enterprise software. This may include writing application interfaces, customizing vendor software and writing custom reports.  You are experienced with modern Java technologies, web development, databases (Oracle experience is preferred), and have application integration experience.  You are able to configure off-the-shelf software, or develop it yourself, based on our client’s needs. Requirements include:  University Degree in the field of Computer Science or Information Technology with four years experience in related roles consistent with the area of applications or equivalent combined education and experience; possession of current industry certifications and a valid B.C. Class 5 Driver’s License. ITIL Foundations certification would be an asset.

Please click here to see a list of currently supported IT Technologies at the District of Saanich.

*Testing will be conducted*
entry.summary:
Information Technology Division
Operations Section

Regular Full Time Position
Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.
Bargaining Unit Position

This may include writing application interfaces, customizing vendor software and writing custom reports.  You are experienced with modern Java technologies, web development, databases (Oracle experience is preferred), and have application integration experience.  You are able to configure off-the-shelf software, or develop it yourself, based on our client’s needs. entry.title: Assistant Manager, Food & Beverage Development & Operations - Competition No. 92.13
entry.content:
Parks and Recreation Department
Recreation Services Division
Cedar Hill Recreation Campus (Cedar Hill Recreation Centre and Golf Course)

Temporary Full Time Position - Up to 24 months; Additional term may be considered
Exempt Position
Wage: $66,379/year

The District of Saanich is seeking an experienced Assistant Manager for the Food & Beverage Development & Operations of the Cedar Hill Golf Course Clubhouse and Cedar Hill Recreation Centre Gallery Café.  The Assistant Manager will provide professional food and beverage leadership as it relates to the effective development of new business streams and the management of food and beverage service operations at both locations.  This includes, but is not limited to: food services planning, purchasing, inventory, cost controls, event sales and management, training, evaluation and supervision. 

The ideal candidate will have experience within a golf or private club setting managing in a unionized environment.  Requirements include:  4 years progressively responsible experience in the growth and management of food and beverage operations with a focus on banquets and event/conference management; two year diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience relevant to the management of food and beverage operations; possession of valid Serving It Right, Food Safe Level 2, WHMIS certificates and a satisfactory Police Information Check.

*Testing will be conducted*

Please note that initial screening of applications will be conducted by Chemistry Consulting Group Inc.
entry.summary:
Parks and Recreation Department
Recreation Services Division
Cedar Hill Recreation Campus (Cedar Hill Recreation Centre and Golf Course)

Temporary Full Time Position - Up to 24 months; Additional term may be considered
Exempt Position
Wage: $66,379/year

The District of Saanich is seeking an experienced Assistant Manager for the Food & Beverage Development & Operations of the Cedar Hill Golf Course Clubhouse and Cedar Hill Recreation Centre Gallery Café.  The Assistant Manager will provide professional food and beverage leadership as it relates to the effective development of new business streams and the management of food and beverage service operations at both locations.  This includes, but is not limited to: food services planning, purchasing, inventory, cost controls, event sales and management, training, evaluation and supervision. 

The ideal candidate will have experience within a golf or private club setting managing in a unionized environment.  Requirements include:  4 years progressively responsible experience in the growth and management of food and beverage operations with a focus on banquets and event/conference management; two year diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience relevant to the management of food and beverage operations; possession of valid Serving It Right, Food Safe Level 2, WHMIS certificates and a satisfactory Police Information Check.

*Testing will be conducted*

Please note that initial screening of applications will be conducted by Chemistry Consulting Group Inc.

entry.title: Assistant IT Manager - Competition No. 54.13
entry.content:
Information Technology Division

Regular Full Time Position
Exempt Position
Wage: $6,692-$7,826/month

The District of Saanich is seeking a highly-adaptive leader to join our motivated and progressive SaanichIT team.  Reporting to the Manager of Information Technology, the Assistant IT Manager is responsible for providing direction to technology-related initiatives for the organization by ensuring that the administration, planning, management and operation of program areas aligns with the goals of the Division, based upon needs of the organization and community we serve. Program areas include, but are not limited to:  Infrastructure, Project Management Office, Service Delivery and Asset Management. The first assignment is to lead the IT Infrastructure portfolio; this is comprised of servers, storage, network, desktop, and applications. Requirements include Bachelor Degree in Computer Science from a University or Technical Institute or an equivalent combination of education and experience; minimum of 7 years related IT experience, including a minimum of three in a progressively senior management capacity, preferably in the area of IT Operations / Infrastructure; current relevant certifications and proven knowledge in ITIL Service Management Foundation Certificate.  Knowledge and experience of Enterprise level IT processes and Service Delivery is a significant asset.

*Testing will be conducted.*
entry.summary:
Information Technology Division

Regular Full Time Position
Exempt Position
Wage: $6,692-$7,826/month

Program areas include, but are not limited to:  Infrastructure, Project Management Office, Service Delivery and Asset Management. The first assignment is to lead the IT Infrastructure portfolio; this is comprised of servers, storage, network, desktop, and applications. Requirements include Bachelor Degree in Computer Science from a University or Technical Institute or an equivalent combination of education and experience; minimum of 7 years related IT experience, including a minimum of three in a progressively senior management capacity, preferably in the area of IT Operations / Infrastructure; current relevant certifications and proven knowledge in ITIL Service Management Foundation Certificate.  Knowledge and experience of Enterprise level IT processes and Service Delivery is a significant asset.

*Testing will be conducted.*

entry.content:
Parks and Recreation Department
Parks Division
All Sections

Approximately 8 months

The Parks Department is seeking multiple temporary full time positions to perform a variety of manual tasks in the maintenance of park areas in any of the following sections:   Horticulture, Maintenance, Construction, Urban Forestry and Natural Areas. entry.title: Student GIS Technician - Competition No. 50.13
entry.content:
Finance Department
Information Technology Division
GIS Section

*Student Opportunity*
Temporary Full Time Position
Term Length:  Up to four months  (May 6 - August 30, 2013)
*This vacancy is only available for students: Enrolment in a full time post secondary education program is mandatory.

The primary work involves the compilation of municipal infrastructure into an enterprise SDE geodatabase.  Data has been collected by field crews using mobile asset management software and needs to be reviewed and digitized into the GIS.   This work requires a solid foundation in GIS theory and ArcGIS desktop, strong problem solving skills and attention to detail.  Opportunities will be given to learn important GIS skills such as data manipulation, GPS field data capture, metadata compilation and map design.  This is a challenging and rewarding position where mentoring is offered while learning, innovation and growth are encouraged.

Bargaining Unit Position
Wage: $23.06/hour
entry.summary:
Finance Department
Information Technology Division
GIS Section

*Student Opportunity*
Temporary Full Time Position
Term Length:  Up to four months  (May 6 - August 30, 2013)
*This vacancy is only available for students: Enrolment in a full time post secondary education program is mandatory.

The primary work involves the compilation of municipal infrastructure into an enterprise SDE geodatabase.  Data has been collected by field crews using mobile asset management software and needs to be reviewed and digitized into the GIS.   This work requires a solid foundation in GIS theory and ArcGIS desktop, strong problem solving skills and attention to detail.  Opportunities will be given to learn important GIS skills such as data manipulation, GPS field data capture, metadata compilation and map design.  This is a challenging and rewarding position where mentoring is offered while learning, innovation and growth are encouraged.

Bargaining Unit Position
Wage: $23.06/hour

entry.title: Business Systems Analyst - Competition No. 134.12
entry.content:
Finance Department
Information Technology Division
Business Systems Section

Auxiliary Relief Position - Two positions available
Bargaining Unit Position
Wage:  $36.63/hour

Covering emergencies that may arise with JDEdwards and ePersonality Systems

JDEdwards Financial System support:  The primary financial system requiring coverage is JDEdwards, and you must have proven and solid technical expertise with this technology.  The District uses version 8.11 sp1 with tools release 8.98.3.  You must be available on call to work on site at the District of Saanich.  You have the ability to work effectively with vendor representatives to communicate technical questions and resolve issues.

Highline ePersonality System support: The primary payroll system requiring coverage is Highline's ePersonality, and you must have proven and solid technical expertise with this technology.  You must be available on call to work on site at the District of Saanich.  You have the ability to work effectively with vendor representatives to communicate technical questions and resolve issues.

*Testing will be conducted.*
entry.summary:

JDEdwards Financial System support:  The primary financial system requiring coverage is JDEdwards, and you must have proven and solid technical expertise with this technology.  The District uses version 8.11 sp1 with tools release 8.98.3.  You must be available on call to work on site at the District of Saanich.  You have the ability to work effectively with vendor representatives to communicate technical questions and resolve issues.

Highline ePersonality System support: The primary payroll system requiring coverage is Highline's ePersonality, and you must have proven and solid technical expertise with this technology.  You must be available on call to work on site at the District of Saanich.  You have the ability to work effectively with vendor representatives to communicate technical questions and resolve issues.

entry.title: Senior Fire Mechanic
entry.content:
Fire Department
Mechanical Division

Regular Full Time position
Bargaining Unit Position
Wage:  $8,250/month

The hours of duty for the Mechanical Division shall be forty (40) hours per week based on four (4) working days of ten (10) hours each from 08:00 to 18:00 hours, Monday to Friday, with the Chief of the Department having the discretion to determine the four (4) working days

*Testing will be conducted.*
